item.title: India Ink: Families of Indians on Missing Flight Plead for Information
item.description: They say they have had very little official information about the developments in the search for the Malaysia Airlines jetliner.
item.dc:creator: By NIDA NAJAR
item.media:description: K.S. Narendran, center, husband of Chandrika Sharma, a passenger in the missing Malaysia Airlines aircraft, speaking to journalists in Chennai, India, on Wednesday.

item.title: U.S. Navy Strategists Have a Long History of Finding the Lost
item.description: The Office of Naval Intelligence has refined some of the most creative techniques that have been used to find sunken ships, spent warheads and downed pilots.
item.dc:creator: By BENEDICT CAREY
item.media:description: The submarine Scorpion was found by a Navy team after it sank in the North Atlantic in 1968.

item.title: World Briefing: Japan: Man Arrested in Damage to Anne Frank Books
item.description: The police on Friday arrested a man who said he tore pages out of books related to Anne Frank at a Tokyo library.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Israel: Military Fires Into Lebanon After Border Blast
item.description: A large explosive device was detonated against an Israeli Army vehicle patrolling the Israel-Lebanon border on Friday, and the Israeli military responded with tank and artillery fire.
item.dc:creator: By ISABEL KERSHNER

item.title: Diplomat From India Is Indicted Again Over Housekeeper
item.description: Devyani Khobragade faced the new charges of visa fraud, two days after a judge accepted her claim of diplomatic immunity and dismissed earlier charges.
item.dc:creator: By ASHLEY SOUTHALL

item.title: As Syria Prepares for Election, U.N. Envoy Plans Trip to Its Ally Iran
item.description: Lakhdar Brahimi, the Syria mediator for the United Nations, is scheduled to arrive in Tehran on Sunday to urge Iran to help in peace talks on Syria.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By SOMINI SENGUPTA
item.media:description: Lakhdar Brahimi, the Syria mediator for the United Nations, is scheduled to arrive in Tehran on Sunday to urge Iran to assist in peace talks on Syria.

item.title: France Convicts Rwandan Ex-Officer of Genocide
item.description: Pascal Simbikangwa, a former intelligence officer, is the first Rwandan fugitive accused of genocide to be convicted in France, and he was sentenced to 25 years in prison.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By MAÏA de la BAUME
item.media:description: Pascal Simbikangwa, a former intelligence officer, was sentenced to 25 years in prison.

item.title: Rumors Mushroom in Eastern Ukraine, Fueling Expectations of War
item.description: As the interim government in Kiev seeks to consolidate its power in the country’s east, a potent information war has emerged between supporters of Ukraine and of Russia.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW ROTH
item.media:description: The police shielded pro-Ukraine protesters, some injured, in clashes in Donetsk, an eastern city.

item.title: U.S.-Russia Talks on Ukraine Fail to Ease Tension
item.description: As Moscow ordered more military exercises on Ukraine’s border, Secretary of State John Kerry met the Russian foreign minister but failed to find a solution.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and STEVEN LEE MYERS

item.title: In Venezuela, Conciliatory Talk but Combative Tactics
item.description: After more than a month of protests and bloody unrest, President Nicolás Maduro has projected an image of openness and inclusion, while simultaneously cracking down.
item.dc:creator: By WILLIAM NEUMAN
item.media:description: A protester in Caracas was arrested on Thursday by Venezuela’s national police during a rally against the government.

item.title: Official Targets ‘Russophobia’
item.description: Amid fears of conflict in Ukraine, a member of Parliament proposed a bill to penalize “Russophobic propaganda” in Russia, imposing penalties of 15 days in prison or a fine of about $1,370.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: The Saturday Profile: Saudi’s Lonely, Costly Bid for Sunni-Shiite Equality
item.description: Mikhlif al-Shammari has been jailed and even shot by his own son because he holds a very unusual conviction in his deeply conservative country: that Shiites should be treated equally.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT F. WORTH
item.media:description: ‘I’m ready to pay with my life for my beliefs.’ MIKHLIF AL-SHAMMARI

item.title: The Lede: Now, the ‘Shut Up Your Mouse, Obama’ Dance Remix
item.description: YouTube video of an Egyptian woman’s rant at President Obama
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: The Lede: Witness Accounts and Video of a Deadly Attack by Russian Separatists in Ukraine Undercut Kremlin Claims
item.description: The morning after journalists watched a pro-Russia mob attack peaceful protesters in the eastern Ukrainian city of Donetsk, leaving at least one young demonstrator dead, Russia’s foreign ministry claimed that the exact opposite had occurred.
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: Leading Militant Killed in Mali, Military Officials Say
item.description: Oumar Ould Hamaha, known for his red beard, his bloodthirsty statements to the media and his role in kidnapping a Canadian diplomat in 2008, was killed by French forces, the officials said.
item.dc:creator: By ADAM NOSSITER

item.title: Radar Suggests Jet Shifted Path More Than Once
item.description: A military radar track appeared to show that Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 climbed to 45,000 feet after disappearing from civilian radar and altered its course as if still under a pilot’s command.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
item.media:description: A Royal Malaysian Air Force aircraft participated in the search for the missing Malaysia Airlines jet over the Strait of Malacca on Friday.

item.title: World Briefing: Austria Holds Ukrainian Pending Extradition Decision
item.description: A court ruled that it would continue to hold Dmitry V. Firtash, a billionaire with ties to Ukraine’s ousted president, and set bail at $174 million after his arrest on an American warrant.
item.dc:creator: By MELISSA EDDY

item.title: Shock as Militants Attack Nigerian Military Prison
item.description: Militants suspected of being members of Boko Haram attacked a military prison in northern Nigeria, freeing some of their comrades but also suffering heavy losses.
item.dc:creator: By ADAM NOSSITER

item.title: 2 Choices in Crimea Referendum, but Neither Is ‘No’
item.description: The ballot referendum will present two options for the region: joining Russia or increasing its autonomy within the Ukrainian government.
item.dc:creator: By NOAH SNEIDER
item.media:credit: Uriel Sinai for The New York Times
item.media:description: Crimeans look at signs in support of joining Russia.

item.title: Pressure and Intimidation Sweep Crimea Ahead of Secession Vote
item.description: With the implicit threat of force, the Kremlin has succeeded in recreating the constrained conditions of Russia’s own civic sphere.
item.dc:creator: By C. J. CHIVERS and PATRICK REEVELL
item.media:description: Men in Cossack uniforms standing guard outside the regional Parliament in Crimea on Friday ahead of the referendum.

item.title: Satellite Firm Says Its Data Could Offer Location of Missing Flight
item.description: As the hunt for the missing Malaysia Airlines jet pushed into the Indian Ocean, a satellite company, Inmarsat, said it had recorded electronic signals that could prove to be the first big break in helping narrow the search.
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and NICOLA CLARK
item.media:description: A captain of the Royal Malaysian Air Force, Izam Fareq Hassan, right, talked with his team members during a search and rescue operation over the Strait of Malacca on Friday.

item.title: Bayern Munich President Accepts Jail Term for Tax Evasion
item.description: Uli Hoeness, a revered figure in German soccer, said that he would resign as team president and that he would not appeal his sentence of three and a half years in prison.
item.dc:creator: By MELISSA EDDY
item.media:description: Uli Hoeness at the annual meeting of Bayern Munich in November.

item.title: World Briefing: Chinese Activist Dies in Custody
item.description: The activist, Cao Shunli, 52, fell ill after being detained last fall and died of a lung infection, said her brother, who charged that the authorities failed to give her timely medical treatment.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY

item.title: Ahmad Tejan Kabbah, Who Guided Sierra Leone to Peace, Dies at 82
item.description: As president of the West African nation, Mr. Kabbah ended an 11-year civil war, though he could not lift the country from poverty.
item.dc:creator: By AGENCE FRANCE-PRESSE
item.media:description: Former President Ahmad Tejan Kabbah of Sierra Leone, who oversaw the end of the country's brutal 11-year civil war, died at 82 in Freetown.

item.title: India Ink: Image of the Day: March 14
item.description: A man preparing campaign material to be used by political parties for the upcoming national elections due in April-May.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES
